data: PED NEPH Peritoneal Dialysis Catheter Insertion (Multiphase)
Inpatient ward nurse to Initiate Pre Procedure phase of this plan
Ensure supplies are accompanied with patient to the operating room
Except for Medication, Except for Sips of Water, No food after midnight on night before procedure. May drink clear fluids after midnight until 2 hours prior to procedure
No fleet enema for patients with renal impairment
Inpatient ward nurse to initiate Post Procedure (Floor) phase of this PowerPlan after discharge from the Anesthetic Care Unit
Discontinue Pre Procedure phase of the NEPH Peritoneal Dialysis Catheter Insertion (Multiphase) PowerPlan
Patient to follow up with PD clinic for first catheter flush
Site: PD catheter exit site, Instructions:  Keep dry and intact. Change q1week for 2 weeks or until exit site healed
If uncontrolled pain, ongoing bleeding from insertion site, fever or nausea/vomiting
Initial flush for peritoneal dialysis catheter
When patient returns to ward, perform 3 or more quick in-and-out flushes with the new PD catheter with 1.5 % Dianeal Solution with heparin 500 units/L until fluid is clear or pink tinged
unit, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj
1,000 unit, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj

For pain management orders, including antiemetics and antipruritics, use either the PED Pain and Symptom Management for Age Greater than or Equal to 6 Months OR the PED Pain and Symptom Management for Age Less than 6 Months PowerPlans
